comments:
Add a new entity to an orm.xml file using the right-click 'Add Persistent Class' action on the EntityMappings node in the JPA Structure view.  After choosing a class, select in the orm.xml source file and press control space in the entity element, choose the table element and press enter.  This exception occurs:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.resource.TableTranslator.createEMFObject(TableTranslator.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.setTargetFromNode(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1516)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.<init>(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.emf2xml.EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.<init>(EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.emf2xml.EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.primCreateAdapter(EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.java:266)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.createAdapter(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:851)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.primUpdateMOFFeature(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1380)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.updateMOFFeature(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1755)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.primUpdateMOF(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:929)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.updateMOF(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:909)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.emf2xml.EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.notifyChanged(EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.java:224)
	at org.eclipse.wst.sse.core.internal.provisional.AbstractNotifier.notify(AbstractNotifier.java:201)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.document.XMLModelNotifierImpl.notifyStructureChanged(XMLModelNotifierImpl.java:392)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.document.XMLModelNotifierImpl.endChanging(XMLModelNotifierImpl.java:180)
You must delete the table element and edit it through the JPA Details View instead to get it to update again and not throw the NPE.
You can get a similar exception adding an attribute override instead of a table

Created an attachment (id=69337)
proposed patch

The attached patch fixes this bug and several others that are very similar.  When we created an object outside of the translators, things were not getting set correctly in our translators.  We store several model objects throughout the translators, these are the locations I fixed.  When we get the new translator for a new object, set the object on that translator.
Tested and approved.  Requesting PMC approval.
